section1.title: 1. Privacy at a Glance
section1.generalText: The following notes provide a simple overview of what happens to your personal data when you visit this website. Personal data is any data that can be used to personally identify you.
section1.responsibleQuestion: Who is responsible for data collection on this website?
section1.responsibleIntro: Data processing on this website is carried out by:
section1.dpoText: [If a DPO is appointed, insert name and contact details here. If no DPO is required, remove this section.]
section1.serviceText: Our translation service works with minimal data collection. You do not need a user account and do not need to register to translate documents. We do not store personal data from end users beyond the processing duration. Your documents are processed without being associated with a personal identity.
section1.howCollectQuestion: How do we collect your data?
section1.howCollectText: The only data we actively collect are the documents you upload for translation. Additionally, technical data (such as your IP address) is automatically collected, which is technically required for website operation. This is deleted after a maximum of 1 hour.
section1.purposeQuestion: What do we use your data for?
section1.purposeText: Uploaded documents are processed exclusively for translation purposes. After processing is complete, all personal data is automatically deleted. Only anonymous usage statistics (token count, costs) are retained for service improvement. There is no sharing with third parties for their own purposes and no use as AI training data.
section1.rightsQuestion: What rights do you have regarding your data?
section1.rightsText: You have the right at any time to receive information about the origin, recipients and purpose of your stored personal data. You also have the right to request rectification, restriction of processing or deletion of this data. You can contact us at any time regarding this and other data protection questions. You also have the right to lodge a complaint with the competent supervisory authority.

section2.title: 2. General Information and Mandatory Disclosures
section2.privacyText: The operators of these pages take the protection of your personal data very seriously. We treat your personal data confidentially and in accordance with statutory data protection regulations and this privacy policy.
section2.responsibleIntro: The responsible entity for data processing on this website is:
section2.responsibleNote: The responsible entity is the natural or legal person who alone or jointly with others determines the purposes and means of processing personal data (e.g., names, email addresses, etc.).
section2.supervisoryName: State Commissioner for Data Protection and Freedom of Information [Federal State]
section2.definitionsIntro: Following the model of Art. 4 GDPR, this privacy policy is based on the following definitions:

definitions.definition: means any information relating to an identified or identifiable person.
means any operation performed on personal data, whether or not by automated means.
means the natural or legal person who alone or jointly with others determines the purposes and means of processing personal data.
means a natural or legal person who processes personal data on behalf of the controller.

means any freely given, specific, informed and unambiguous indication of the data subject's wishes by which they, by a statement or by a clear affirmative action, signify agreement to the processing of personal data relating to them.
means personal data related to the physical or mental health of a natural person, including the provision of health care services, which reveal information about their health status.

section2.storageText: Uploaded documents and their translations are deleted from active systems immediately after processing is complete, in any case within 1 hour. This period allows you to provide optional feedback on your translation. The following data is cleaned up:
section2.storageNote: This short storage period maximizes your data protection. After deletion from active systems, the data is no longer recoverable.
section2.storageRetainedText: To improve our service and monitor costs, we retain only anonymous, aggregated usage statistics (e.g., token count, processing costs, AI models used). This data contains no personal information and cannot be traced back to you.
section2.voluntaryText: Providing your documents is voluntary. However, without uploading a document, our translation service cannot be used. You decide which documents you submit for translation. There is no legal or contractual obligation to provide personal data.
section2.sslText: For security reasons and to protect the transmission of confidential content, such as medical documents you send to us, this site uses SSL/TLS encryption. You can recognize an encrypted connection by the browser address bar changing from "http://" to "https://" and the lock icon in your browser bar.

section3.title: 3. Data Collection on This Website
section3.cookiesText: We do not use marketing, analytics, or tracking cookies. Our service only uses strictly necessary cookies required for website functionality.
section3.cookiesLanguage: We set a cookie to store your preferred language setting. This cookie ("i18next") stores your selected language so that the website is automatically displayed in your preferred language on your next visit. This cookie contains no personal data and is purely functional.
section3.cookiesCloudflare: Cloudflare may set strictly necessary security cookies depending on configuration to protect our website from cyber attacks and ensure the integrity of our service. These cookies are used solely for security purposes and contain no personal data for advertising purposes.
section3.cookiesLocalStorage: Additionally, we use browser localStorage to save your preference for the cookie notice banner (whether you have closed the banner). This information is only stored locally in your browser and is not transmitted to our server.
section3.cookiesConsentNote: Since we only use strictly necessary cookies, no consent is required under Section 25(2) No. 2 TDDDG (formerly TTDSG). These cookies are essential for providing the service.
section3.serverLogsText: The provider of these pages automatically collects and stores information in so-called server log files, which your browser automatically transmits to us. These are:
section3.serverLogsNote: This data is not merged with other data sources. Processing of server log data is based on our legitimate interest in the security and stability of our services pursuant to Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR. Log data is automatically deleted after a maximum of 1 hour.
section3.serverLogsObjection: Your right to object: You have the right to object at any time to the processing of your personal data based on Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR for reasons arising from your particular situation (Art. 21 GDPR). Please address your objection to the contact details provided above.
section3.medicalText: When using our translation service for medical documents, the following data protection measures apply:

medicalItems.title: Automatic PII Removal
medicalItems.text: Before processing by AI systems, personal information (names, addresses, phone numbers, dates of birth, insurance numbers) is automatically removed from documents. This is done locally on our servers using spaCy NER (Named Entity Recognition) and special patterns for German medical documents.

medicalItems.title: Temporary Storage
medicalItems.text: Documents are only temporarily stored for the duration of processing (maximum 1 hour).

medicalItems.title: Automatic Deletion
medicalItems.text: After translation is complete, all personal data is immediately deleted from active systems, in any case within 1 hour. Only anonymous usage statistics are retained.

medicalItems.title: No Permanent Storage
medicalItems.text: There is no permanent storage of documents or translations.

medicalItems.title: No Use as Training Data
medicalItems.text: Your documents and translations are not used as training data for AI models.

medicalItems.title: Encrypted Transmission
medicalItems.text: All data is transmitted encrypted via HTTPS/TLS.

medicalItems.title: Encryption at Rest
medicalItems.text: All uploaded documents are encrypted with AES-256-GCM and stored in the database. Administrator accounts additionally use encrypted storage for email addresses and names.

medicalItems.title: No Tracking Cookies
medicalItems.text: Our service does not use marketing, analytics, or tracking cookies. Only strictly necessary cookies for language settings and security are used.

medicalItems.title: Data Processing Predominantly in the EU
medicalItems.text: Processing of your documents takes place exclusively within the EU (Germany and France). For CDN and security services (Cloudflare), data transfer to the USA may occur, secured by EU Standard Contractual Clauses and the EU-US Data Privacy Framework (see Section 6).

section4.title: 4. Legal Bases for Processing
section4.intro: For the various processing activities, we rely on the following legal bases:

legalBases.explanation: Processing is necessary to fulfill the contract for the provision of digital content (Sections 327 et seq. German Civil Code) concluded between you and us.

legalBases.basis: Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR (contract performance) + Art. 9(2)(a) GDPR (explicit consent)
legalBases.explanation: Processing is carried out to fulfill the translation contract (Art. 6). Since medical documents regularly contain health data, your explicit consent under Art. 9 GDPR is additionally required (see Section 9 - Your Consent).
Processing is necessary to ensure the security and stability of our services.
Processing of your feedback data is based on your voluntary consent.

section5.title: 5. Special Notes on Health Data Protection
section5.intro: Since our service enables the processing of medical documents that may contain health data, we specifically note:
items: Health data belongs to the special categories of personal data under Art. 9 GDPR.
We process this data exclusively for translation purposes and only with your explicit and separate consent (see Section 9).
Before AI processing, all personal information (names, addresses, phone numbers, etc.) is automatically removed.
Special technical and organizational measures are taken to protect this data (encryption, short storage duration, automatic deletion).
All data is immediately deleted from active systems after processing, in any case within 1 hour.
The translation results serve solely for your information and do not replace medical consultation and advice. No review, diagnosis, or therapy recommendation takes place.

section6.title: 6. Third Parties and Data Processing
section6.intro: We use the following third-party providers to deliver our service. Data processing takes place predominantly within the European Union. For CDN and security services (Cloudflare), data transfer to the USA may occur, secured by appropriate safeguards.

cloudflare.title: Cloudflare (USA/Global)
cloudflare.address: Cloudflare, Inc., 101 Townsend St, San Francisco, CA 94107, USA
cloudflare.purpose: Protecting your sensitive health data is our highest priority. We use Cloudflare as a Content Delivery Network (CDN) and for DNS services with proxy enabled to protect our website and your data from cyber attacks. Cloudflare provides DDoS protection, Web Application Firewall (WAF), and performance optimization.
cloudflare.importance: Using Cloudflare is essential for us to ensure the availability and security of our service. Given the sensitive nature of medical documents, professional protection against hacker attacks, bot attacks, and other threats is indispensable.
cloudflare.dataProcessed: Each time you access our website, the following data is processed by Cloudflare: IP address, accessed URL, HTTP headers (browser, operating system, referrer), timestamp of the request, amount of data transferred.
cloudflare.security: Cloudflare analyzes traffic to detect and prevent attacks (DDoS, bot attacks, SQL injection). This serves to protect our infrastructure and your data.
cloudflare.legalBasis: Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR (legitimate interest in the security and availability of our website).
cloudflare.thirdCountryTransfer: Cloudflare is a US company. Data transfer to the USA is based on EU Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) pursuant to Art. 46(2)(c) GDPR as well as the EU-US Data Privacy Framework. Cloudflare is certified under the Data Privacy Framework.
cloudflare.retention: Cloudflare stores log data for a maximum of 24 hours for security purposes. We have no access to these logs.
cloudflare.dpaNote: A Data Processing Addendum (DPA) pursuant to Art. 28 GDPR exists with Cloudflare.
cloudflare.optOut: Since Cloudflare is essential for the security and accessibility of our website, use without Cloudflare is not possible. Processing is based on our legitimate interest.

mistral.title: Mistral AI (France/EU)
mistral.address: Mistral AI, 15 rue des Halles, 75001 Paris, France
mistral.purpose: AI-powered text recognition (OCR) and translation. Only PII-cleaned texts are transmitted to Mistral AI for translation.
mistral.ocrNote: Important note regarding OCR: During OCR processing, the unprocessed document is transmitted to Mistral AI before PII removal can take place. This circumstance is explicitly covered in the separate consent declaration (Section 9).
mistral.legalBasis: Art. 28 GDPR (Data Processing Agreement). Data processing takes place in France within the EU.

hetzner.title: Hetzner (Germany/EU)
hetzner.address: Hetzner Online GmbH, Industriestr. 25, 91710 Gunzenhausen, Germany
hetzner.purpose: PII removal (removal of personally identifiable information) and fallback OCR service (PaddleOCR). The servers are located in Germany.

railway.title: Railway (USA with EU Data Processing)
railway.address: Railway Corporation, San Francisco, CA, USA
railway.purpose: Hosting of the application and the encrypted PostgreSQL database in the EU region. Railway is SOC 2 Type I certified and offers GDPR-compliant Data Processing Agreements.
railway.thirdCountryNote: Railway is a US company. Data access from the USA cannot be fully excluded. Data transfer is secured by EU Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) pursuant to Art. 46(2)(c) GDPR.

section6.dpaNote: Data Processing Agreements (DPAs) pursuant to Art. 28 GDPR exist with all named third-party providers, ensuring the protection of your data according to European data protection standards. These agreements obligate our partners to comply with strict data protection requirements and to process data only according to our instructions.

section7.title: 7. Important Notice Regarding PII Removal
section7.warning: NO GUARANTEE FOR COMPLETE PII REMOVAL
section7.warningText: The automatic removal of personally identifiable information is a best-effort process. We cannot guarantee that all personal data will be 100% detected and removed.
section7.limitationsText: Despite advanced technologies (spaCy NER, Microsoft Presidio, regex pattern matching), unusual name formats, handwritten notes, or atypical document structures may cause personal data to go undetected.
section7.ocrWarning: Important: During OCR processing, your document is first transmitted to Mistral AI (France) BEFORE PII removal can take place. Personal data is only removed after text recognition.
section7.recommendation: Before uploading, we strongly recommend manually redacting or removing obvious personal data such as names, addresses, birth dates, and insurance numbers.
section7.medicalTermsNote: Medical terms, diagnoses, and findings are deliberately NOT removed as they are required for translation.
section7.consent: By uploading your documents and providing your explicit consent (Section 9), you confirm that you have understood this notice and accept that PII removal cannot be guaranteed to be 100% complete.

section8.title: 8. Automated Processing and Artificial Intelligence
section8.intro: Our service uses artificial intelligence (AI) for text recognition (OCR) and translation of your documents. We would like to inform you about the following important points:
items: AI is used exclusively for technical tasks (text recognition, translation), not for decisions affecting you.
No automated decision-making within the meaning of Art. 22 GDPR takes place that produces legal effects or similarly significantly affects you.
No profiling takes place - the AI does not analyze personal characteristics, preferences, or behaviors.
You retain full control at all times: you decide which documents to upload and can cancel the process at any time.
The translation results serve solely for your information and have no legal or medical consequences.
The AI models used (Mistral AI) are operated by European providers and are subject to the GDPR. The models have not been trained with your data and will not be.

section9.title: 9. Your Consent
section9.intro: The health data you provide when using healthlingo.de is particularly sensitive personal data. It is subject to special protection under Art. 9 GDPR and may not be processed without your explicit consent.
section9.consentRequest: We therefore ask you for the following separate consent declarations:

consent1.title: Consent 1 - Processing of Health Data (required)
consent1.text: I explicitly consent to healthlingo.de processing my health data possibly contained in the uploaded documents for translation purposes. I am aware that:
points: before automatic PII removal, my document is first transmitted to Mistral AI (France/EU) for text recognition (OCR),
automatic PII removal cannot guarantee 100% detection of all personal data,
processing of my documents takes place predominantly within the EU, whereby network metadata may be processed by Cloudflare (USA), secured by EU Standard Contractual Clauses (see Section 6),
my data is immediately deleted from active systems after processing, in any case within 1 hour.

consent2.title: Consent 2 - Feedback and Quality Improvement (optional)
consent2.text: I consent to my feedback and the associated anonymized translation data being stored for a maximum of 90 days for quality improvement purposes.

section9.consentNote: Note: Consent 1 is a prerequisite for using the service. Consent 2 is voluntary and can be granted or refused independently. Each consent can be revoked at any time with effect for the future.
section9.withdrawalText: Each of these consents can be revoked by you at any time with effect for the future. Revocation can be made by:
withdrawalMethods: Contacting us by email at [Email Address]
section9.withdrawalNote: The revocation does not affect the lawfulness of processing carried out on the basis of consent before its revocation. After revocation, all your data will be deleted immediately.
section9.withdrawalConsequence: If you revoke Consent 1, you can no longer use healthlingo.de, as the processing of health data is a prerequisite for providing our service.

section10.title: 10. Your Rights
section10.intro: With regard to your data processed by us, you have the following rights:
section10.accessText: Since we do not store personal data from end users beyond the processing duration, we cannot provide information about stored data after processing is complete, as no such data exists. During processing, you have the right to request information about your processed data.
section10.rectificationText: You have the right to request the rectification of inaccurate personal data.
section10.deletionText: Your uploaded documents are immediately deleted from active systems after processing, in any case within 1 hour. No manual deletion is required. If you have provided feedback with consent, you can request deletion of your data at any time by contacting us.
section10.restrictionTitle: Right to Restriction of Processing (Art. 18 GDPR)
section10.restrictionText: You can cancel the processing of your documents at any time by ending the processing before the translation is complete. In this case, the data is deleted immediately.
section10.portabilityText: You can download the translation results directly after processing.
section10.objectionText: Insofar as processing is based on a legitimate interest (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR), you have the right to object to the processing at any time for reasons arising from your particular situation. This particularly concerns the processing of server log data.
section10.withdrawalText: Insofar as processing is based on your consent (particularly for health data under Art. 9(2)(a) GDPR), you can withdraw this consent at any time. Details can be found in Section 9.
section10.complaintTitle: Right to Lodge a Complaint with a Supervisory Authority
section10.complaintText: In the event of violations of the GDPR, you have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority, particularly in the member state of your habitual residence, your place of work, or the place of the alleged violation.

section11.title: 11. Feedback and User Reviews
section11.intro: On the results page, you have the option to voluntarily provide feedback on your translation. When providing feedback, the following data is collected:
dataCollected: Optional detailed ratings (clarity, accuracy, formatting, speed)
section11.consentNote: Providing feedback requires your separate consent (Consent 2, Section 9). Without this consent, no feedback can be provided.
section11.retentionText: If you provide feedback with consent for quality improvement, your feedback and the associated anonymized translation data will be stored for a maximum of 90 days. You can revoke your consent at any time, whereupon the data will be deleted immediately.
section11.warning: Please note: You should not include personal data (names, addresses, insurance numbers, etc.) in your comment. Such data is not automatically removed and will be stored along with your feedback.

section12.title: 12. Data Security
section12.intro: To protect your personal data, we have implemented appropriate technical and organizational security measures pursuant to Art. 32 GDPR. These include in particular:
measures: Encryption of all data during transmission (HTTPS/TLS) and storage (AES-256-GCM)
Automatic deletion of all personal data after processing
Automatic PII removal before AI processing
Data processing exclusively within the EU
No use of marketing, analytics, or tracking cookies (only strictly necessary cookies for language settings and security)

section13.title: 13. Contact and Data Protection Inquiries
section13.text: For questions about data protection or to exercise your rights, you can contact us at any time:
section13.responseNote: Please specify exactly which data is affected and which right you wish to exercise. We will respond to your request as soon as possible, but no later than within one month.

section14.title: 14. Updates to This Privacy Policy
section14.text: We regularly review and update this privacy policy to meet legal requirements and reflect changes to our services. In the event of material changes, we will inform you through a prominent notice on our website. We recommend visiting this page regularly to stay informed about current privacy practices.
section14.versionNote: The current version is always available on our website.

Deviating, conflicting, or supplementary terms of the User shall not become part of the contract unless the Provider expressly agrees to their validity in writing.

section1.p5: (5) These Terms are directed exclusively at consumers within the meaning of Section 13 German Civil Code (BGB). A consumer is any natural person who enters into a legal transaction for purposes that can predominantly be attributed neither to their commercial nor their independent professional activity. Commercial or professional use of the Service requires a separate written agreement.
section1.p6: (6) All natural persons aged 18 years or older are entitled to use the services of healthlingo.de.

section2.title: Section 2 Definitions
section2.intro: The following definitions apply within the meaning of these Terms:

definitions.definition: The web application provided by healthlingo.de for AI-powered translation of medical documents into patient-friendly language and other target languages.
Any natural person who uses the Service to translate documents, regardless of whether it is their own document or - with appropriate authorization - a document belonging to another person.
Any file (PDF, image, text) uploaded by the User for the purpose of translation, including medical documents such as doctor's letters, medical reports, and lab results.

The result produced by the Service from AI-powered processing of an uploaded document. The translation constitutes a digital product within the meaning of Sections 327 et seq. German Civil Code (BGB).
The Large Language Models (LLM) used in the Service for text recognition (OCR) and translation of medical content.
Personal data such as names, addresses, birth dates, insurance numbers, and other information that makes a person identifiable.

Personal data pursuant to Art. 4 No. 15 GDPR relating to the physical or mental health of a natural person, including the provision of health care services, which reveal information about their health status.

section3.title: Section 3 Contract Formation
section3.p1: (1) The presentation of the Service on the Website does not constitute a binding offer to conclude a contract, but rather a non-binding invitation to the User to use the Service.
section3.p2: (2) The contract for the provision of digital content pursuant to Sections 327 et seq. German Civil Code (BGB) is concluded as follows:
contractSteps: a) The User uploads a document and provides their explicit consent to the processing of health data pursuant to Art. 9(2)(a) GDPR by checking the corresponding checkbox (Consent 1 of the Privacy Policy). This constitutes the User's offer to conclude a contract.
b) The Provider accepts the offer by beginning to process the document.
section3.p3: (3) Providing explicit consent to the processing of health data (Consent 1 according to the Privacy Policy) is a mandatory prerequisite for contract formation. Without this consent, the Service cannot be used.
section3.p4: (4) By using the Service, the User warrants that they have reached the age of 18.
section3.p5: (5) The contract language is German. The contract text is not stored by the Provider and is no longer available after contract formation. However, these Terms can be viewed and printed on the Website at any time.

subsection1.title: 4.1 Subject Matter and Core Functions
subsection1.intro: healthlingo.de is an online service that enables you to have medical documents translated into understandable language. The goal is to enable you as an informed patient to understand the information communicated to you in a medical document. The Service includes:
items: Automatic text recognition (OCR) for uploaded documents using AI
Translation of medical terminology into patient-friendly, understandable language (German)
Translation into additional target languages (English, French, Spanish, Italian, Portuguese, Dutch, Polish)
Automatic removal of personally identifiable information (PII removal) before AI processing
Automated plausibility and consistency checking of the translation (not a substitute for medical advice)
subsection1.note: The service is technically programmed so that document translation functions fully automatically. The information from the original document is not medically evaluated, interpreted, or supplemented, but only machine-translated.

subsection2.title: 4.2 Not a Substitute for Medical Advice
subsection2.text: healthlingo.de merely provides a service to inform and support patients and cannot replace medical advice in any case. The web application does not make diagnoses and does not make therapy decisions.

subsection3.title: 4.3 Supported Document Types and File Formats
subsection3.documentTypes: The Service supports the following document types: doctor's letters and discharge summaries, medical reports and radiological findings, lab results and blood tests, as well as other medical documents.
subsection3.fileFormats: Accepted file formats: PDF, JPEG, JPG, PNG, GIF, BMP, TIFF, WebP. The maximum file size is 100 MB per document.

subsection4.title: 4.4 Processing Time
subsection4.text: Processing time depends on document size and complexity. Processing typically occurs within a few minutes.

subsection5.title: 4.5 Free of Charge
subsection5.text: The Service is currently offered free of charge. The Provider reserves the right to introduce paid additional features in the future.

subsection6.title: 4.6 Provision of Results
subsection6.text: By making the translation available to you via the web application, the digital product has been provided to you within the meaning of Section 327b(3) German Civil Code (BGB).

subsection7.title: 4.7 No Guarantee of Translation Quality
subsection7.text: The Provider gives no warranty for the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, or suitability of the translations. AI-generated content may contain errors.

subsection8.title: 4.8 Changes to Services
subsection8.text: The Provider reserves the right to change, expand, or discontinue the Website and the services provided thereon.

section5.title: Section 5 Usage Requirements
section5.p1: (1) Using the Service requires an internet-capable computer, smartphone, or other suitable device with a modern web browser.
section5.p2: (2) Recommended browsers: Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Safari, Microsoft Edge (current version in each case).
section5.p3: (3) A stable internet connection is required for use.
section5.p4: (4) JavaScript must be enabled in the browser.
section5.p5: (5) The User is responsible for ensuring that their technical equipment enables use of the Service.
section5.p6: (6) Registration or creation of a user account is not required.

section6.title: Section 6 Usage Rights
section6.p1: (1) The User receives from the Provider a free, simple (non-exclusive), personal, non-transferable, revocable license to use the Service and the translation results for personal, non-commercial use.
section6.p2: (2) Commercial use of the translation results requires prior written approval from the Provider.
section6.p3: (3) Information, brand names, design, and other content of healthlingo.de may not be used without permission.
section6.p4: (4) If the User violates these provisions, all granted rights become immediately void.

section7.title: Section 7 User Obligations
section7.intro: The User agrees to the following conduct:

obligations.title: 7.1 Lawful Use
obligations.text: The Service may only be used for lawful purposes. The User ensures that they are authorized to use the uploaded documents.

obligations.title: 7.2 Own Documents Only
obligations.text: The User may generally only upload their own documents. An exception exists with appropriate authorization (e.g., legal guardianship, power of attorney).

obligations.title: 7.3 Consent from Third Parties
obligations.text: If documents containing personal data of third parties are uploaded, the User must have obtained the consent of those persons.

obligations.title: 7.4 No Manipulation
obligations.text: The User refrains from any attempts to manipulate or impair the technical infrastructure of the Service.

obligations.title: 7.5 No Automated Use
obligations.text: Automated or systematic querying of the Service (e.g., by bots) is prohibited without permission.

obligations.title: 7.6 Personal Responsibility
obligations.text: The User bears full responsibility for all actions using the Service.

obligations.title: 7.7 Review of Results
obligations.text: The User is obligated to critically review the translation results and seek professional medical advice in case of uncertainties.

obligations.title: 7.8 Redaction of Sensitive Data
obligations.text: The User should manually redact obvious personal data before uploading (see Section 10).

section8.title: Section 8 Prohibited Use
section8.intro: The following uses of the Service are expressly prohibited:
prohibitions: Uploading documents for which the User is not authorized to process
Uploading documents with unlawful, defamatory, or otherwise objectionable content
Uploading documents that violate the intellectual property rights of third parties
Attempts to gain unauthorized access to Provider systems
Reverse engineering of the Service (subject to Section 69e German Copyright Act)
Use for generating training data for proprietary AI models
Any use that violates applicable law
section8.consequence: In case of violations, the Provider reserves the right to block access to the Service and take legal action.

section9.title: Section 9 Medical Disclaimer
section9.warning: IMPORTANT NOTICE: The translations provided do NOT constitute medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment recommendation!

subsection1.title: 9.1 No Medical Advice
items: The translations are fully automatically created by artificial intelligence and may contain errors.
The translations serve solely for information and better understanding of medical documents.
The translations do not replace professional medical advice under any circumstances.
healthlingo.de does not serve for the diagnosis, prevention, monitoring, or treatment of diseases.

subsection2.title: 9.2 Behavioral Guidelines
items: Never make medical decisions based solely on the translations.
Always consult a qualified doctor for medical questions.
In medical emergencies, contact emergency services (112) immediately.
Never discontinue doctor-prescribed treatment based on the translations.

subsection3.title: 9.3 No Doctor-Patient Relationship
subsection3.text: Using the Service does not establish a doctor-patient relationship. The Provider does not provide medical services.

section9.acknowledgment: By using the Service, you confirm that you have read, understood, and accepted this medical disclaimer.
